The **Prime Minister of Mauritius** (French: _Premier Ministre de Maurice_) is
the [head of government](/wiki/Head_of_government "Head of government") of
[Mauritius](/wiki/Mauritius "Mauritius"). He presides over the Cabinet of
Ministers which advises the [President](/wiki/President_of_Mauritius
"President of Mauritius") of the Country and is collectively responsible to
the [National Assembly](/wiki/National_Assembly_\(Mauritius\) "National
Assembly \(Mauritius\)") for any advice given and for all action done by or
under the authority of any Minister in the execution of his office.

The position is the most powerful constitutional office of the Republic. This
is mainly because the office is amalgamated with other functions whereby
conventions, the office holder is also the [ Minister of Defense & Home
Affairs](/wiki/Interior_ministry "Interior ministry") (which makes the office
holder responsible for law & order, internal security, defense, the armed
forces and intelligence services), the [Leader of the National
Assembly](/wiki/Leader_of_the_House_of_Commons "Leader of the House of
Commons") (which makes the office holder responsible for setting the agenda
for parliament) and Minister for Rodrigues & Dependencies (which makes the
office holder responsible for territorial occupancy, administration of local
dependencies & their defense). It is also inter-alia, the head of government
and presides over the cabinet of Ministers. It is second in the order of
precedence just after the president and enjoys relative importance in the
public as the office holder is usually the leader of the party/alliance that
wins an election.

The current Prime Minister of [Mauritius](/wiki/Mauritius "Mauritius"),
[Pravind Jugnauth](/wiki/Pravind_Jugnauth "Pravind Jugnauth"), leader of the
[MSM](/wiki/Militant_Socialist_Movement "Militant Socialist Movement"), was
appointed by the President on 23 January 2017 following the resignation of
coalition leader Sir [Anerood Jugnauth](/wiki/Anerood_Jugnauth "Anerood
Jugnauth") who held the post following victory of his Alliance in the [2014
General Election](/wiki/Mauritian_general_election,_2014 "Mauritian general
election, 2014").The [official residence](/wiki/Official_residence "Official
residence") of the Prime Minister during his term in office is the [Clarisse
House](/wiki/Clarisse_House "Clarisse House"), the [Prime Minister's
Office](/wiki/List_of_constitutional_offices_of_Mauritius "List of
constitutional offices of Mauritius") is located in [Port
Louis](/wiki/Port_Louis "Port Louis"). The longest serving prime minister is
[Anerood Jugnauth](/wiki/Anerood_Jugnauth "Anerood Jugnauth") who held the
office for 18th year as Prime Minister.

##
Overview[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Prime_Minister_of_Mauritius&action=edit&section=1
"Edit section: Overview")]

[![\[icon\]](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/1c/Wiki_letter_w_cropped.svg/20px-
Wiki_letter_w_cropped.svg.png)](/wiki/File:Wiki_letter_w_cropped.svg)| This
section **needs expansion**. You can help by [adding to
it](//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Prime_Minister_of_Mauritius&action=edit&section=).
_(December 2012)_  
---|---  
  
The current Prime Minister's portfolio includes, inter-alia, the following:[2]

  * Law and Order
  * Civil Status, Citizenship
  * External Communications
  * Electoral Commissions and Electoral Affairs
  * Government Information Services
  * Meteorological Services
  * Mauritius Oceanography Institute
  * Human Rights
  * Strategic Policy

The Prime Minister is appointed by the President. He or She holds the second
most senior position in the country, second only to the president. The Prime
Minister is usually the leader of the largest party in the ruling coalition.
The position of Prime Minister alongside with the office of [Deputy Prime
Minister](/wiki/Deputy_Prime_Minister_of_Mauritius "Deputy Prime Minister of
Mauritius") is specified under CHAPTER VI Section 59 Part 1 of the
[Constitution of Mauritius](/wiki/Constitution_of_Mauritius "Constitution of
Mauritius").

After the country became a Republic on 12 March 1992, the President became the
[Head of State](/wiki/Head_of_State "Head of State"). The President holds
[prerogative powers](/wiki/Prerogative_powers "Prerogative powers") which
includes summoning, prorogation and dissolution of parliament including
appointment of the Prime Minister and Cabinet. The Prime Minister has the
constitutional duty to advise him/her when to exercise these prerogatives.

##
History[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Prime_Minister_of_Mauritius&action=edit&section=2
"Edit section: History")]

See also: [List of Prime Ministers of
Mauritius](/wiki/List_of_Prime_Ministers_of_Mauritius "List of Prime Ministers
of Mauritius")

### Pre-
Independence[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Prime_Minister_of_Mauritius&action=edit&section=3
"Edit section: Pre-Independence")]

During the [British Mauritius](/wiki/British_Mauritius "British Mauritius")
period, it was the [Chief Minister](/wiki/Chief_Minister "Chief Minister") who
was the [head of government](/wiki/Head_of_government "Head of government"),
[executive powers](/wiki/Executive_\(government\) "Executive \(government\)")
was vested by the Governor, representative of the Monarch. The only Chief
Minister which the country had known was [Sir Seewoosagur
Ramgoolam](/wiki/Seewoosagur_Ramgoolam "Seewoosagur Ramgoolam"), from 26
September 1961 to 12 March 1968.[3]

###
Independence[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Prime_Minister_of_Mauritius&action=edit&section=4
"Edit section: Independence")]

The office of the Prime Minister of Mauritius was created on 12 March 1968
when Mauritius became an independent state. [Queen Elizabeth
II](/wiki/Queen_Elizabeth_II "Queen Elizabeth II") remained as head of state
as [Queen of Mauritius](/wiki/Queen_of_Mauritius "Queen of Mauritius"), with
her executive powers in Mauritius delegated to the [governor-
general](/wiki/Governor-General_of_Mauritius "Governor-General of Mauritius").

After the [1967 General Election](/wiki/Mauritian_general_election,_1967
"Mauritian general election, 1967"), [Sir Seewoosagur
Ramgoolam](/wiki/Seewoosagur_Ramgoolam "Seewoosagur Ramgoolam") (SSR) became
the first Prime Minister of Mauritius, he was re-elected in the [1976 General
Election](/wiki/Mauritian_general_election,_1976 "Mauritian general election,
1976") and remained in office. In the [1982 General
Election](/wiki/Mauritian_general_election,_1982 "Mauritian general election,
1982"), [Sir Anerood Jugnauth](/wiki/Anerood_Jugnauth "Anerood Jugnauth")
(SAJ) coalition was elected, he became Prime Minister. However his alliance
break up in 1983 and the [1983 General
Election](/wiki/Mauritian_general_election,_1983 "Mauritian general election,
1983") was held, SAJ formed another alliance, he was elected again and remain
in office. In the [1987 General
Election](/wiki/Mauritian_general_election,_1987 "Mauritian general election,
1987"), another coalition concluded by SAJ won again, he remained in office.
SAJ also won the [1991 General
Election](/wiki/Mauritian_general_election,_1991 "Mauritian general election,
1991") and remained the Prime Minister of Mauritius. The new leader of the
Labour Party [Dr. Navin Ramgoolam](/wiki/Navin_Ramgoolam "Navin Ramgoolam"),
became the [Leader of the
Opposition](/wiki/Leader_of_the_Opposition_\(Mauritius\) "Leader of the
Opposition \(Mauritius\)").

###
Republic[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Prime_Minister_of_Mauritius&action=edit&section=5
"Edit section: Republic")]

After the country became a Republic on 12 March 1992, the President became the
[Head of State](/wiki/Head_of_State "Head of State"). The President holds
[prerogative powers](/wiki/Prerogative_powers "Prerogative powers") which
includes summoning, prorogation and dissolution of parliament including
appointment of the Prime Minister and Cabinet. The Prime Minister has the
constitutional duty to advise him/her when to exercise these prerogatives.

On 12 March 1992, Mauritius became a Republic State, with a new constitution
in 1992, the terms of the General Elections was regulated to 5 years. Since
then, each 5 years elections take place and a new Prime Minister is elected.
After the [1995 General Election](/wiki/Mauritian_general_election,_1995
"Mauritian general election, 1995"), Dr. Navin Ramgoolam became Prime Minister
of Mauritius for the first time. However, he lost the [2000 General
Election](/wiki/Mauritian_general_election,_2000 "Mauritian general election,
2000"). In 2000, the Prime Minister's office was shared between two leaders,
Sir Anerood Jugnauth spent 3 years as Prime Minister and [Paul
Bérenger](/wiki/Paul_B%C3%A9renger "Paul Bérenger") spent 2 years. After the
[2005 General Election](/wiki/Mauritian_general_election,_2005 "Mauritian
general election, 2005"), Dr. Navin Ramgoolam became the Prime Minister of
Mauritius again. In [2010 General
Election](/wiki/Mauritian_general_election,_2010 "Mauritian general election,
2010"), he was re-elected and remained in office.[4] The [2014 General
Election](/wiki/Mauritian_general_election,_2014 "Mauritian general election,
2014") returned Sir Anerood Jugnauth to the Prime Minister's office.

##
Oaths[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Prime_Minister_of_Mauritius&action=edit&section=6
"Edit section: Oaths")]

According to the third Schedule of the [Constitution of
Mauritius](/wiki/Constitution_of_Mauritius "Constitution of Mauritius"), an
oath under this section shall be administered by the Prime Minister.[5]

> I, ......................, being appointed Prime Minister/Minister/Junior
> Minister, do swear (or solemnly affirm) that I will to the best of my
> judgment, at all times when so required, freely give my counsel and advice
> to the President (or any other person for the time being lawfully performing
> the functions of that office) for the good management of the public affairs
> of Mauritius, and I do further swear (or solemnly affirm) that I will not on
> any account, at any time whatsoever, disclose the counsel, advice, opinion
> or vote of any particular Minister or Junior Minister and that I will not,
> except with the authority of the Cabinet and to such extent as may be
> required for the good management of the affairs of Mauritius, directly or
> indirectly reveal the business or proceedings of the Prime
> Minister/Minister/Junior Minister or any matter coming to my knowledge in my
> capacity as such and that in all things I will be a true and faithful Prime
> Minister/Minister/Junior Minister. (So help me God.)
